origami_tools.Origamis.kresling module

class origami_tools.Origamis.kresling.TDK(n, l, b, r, h1, h2, a=0, r_p=0, nb_stable=2, etages=1, name='')

Bases: object

Class for a Kresling tower

a: float | int = 0
angle_pli_montagne(h)
angle_pli_rho(h)
angle_pli_vallee(h)
as_dict()
b: float | int
create_3D(h_rep=None, type=0, fold_pc=100, ep_tot=0, side=0, h_constr=None, e_pp=0.5)
type :

0 => les plis ne sont pas des bonnes longuers (utilisation de phi) 1 => le panneau n’est pas déformé (utilisation de rho) 2 => le panneau est déformé comme 1 (utilisation des plis vallés / montagnes) 3 => l et b ne sont pas reliés au sommet V (TODO)

fold_pc : pourcentage de pliage (pour le type 2) h_rep : hauteur de la tour représentée h_constr : hauteur de la tour pour laquelle on calcule les plis side : 0 => pas d’asymetrie, 1 => asymetrie montagne, 2 => asymetrie vallee ep_tot : epaisseur pour le calcul (e)

create_motif_base(laser_cut, origin=[0, 0])
create_patron(h=0, attache=None, param_list=None, closing=2, side=0, closing_type=1, outside_param='fold_cut')

Create the patron of the Kresling tower :type h: float | int :param h: height of the tower, if 0, use h1 :type attache: Pattern | None :param attache: Patron to attach to the tower, if None, no attachment. Must be the first one on the top left of the patron and be open on the down side :param laser_cut: ParamList object to use for the patron, if None, use the default list :type closing: int :param closing: number of the closing method :type side: int :param side: 0 => no sides diff, 1 => side1, 2 => side2 :type closing_type: int :param closing_type: 1 => closing at half pane; 2 => closigne at half 2 panes :rtype: Pattern :return: Patron object

classmethod from_dict(d, name='')

Create a Kresling tower from a dictionary :type d: :param d: dictionary with the parameters of the tower :return: Kresling tower

classmethod from_eta(l, b, n, r, etages=1, name='')

Create a Kresling tower from eta :type l: :param l: length of the long side :type b: :param b: length of the short side :type n: :param n: number of folds :type r: :param r: radius of the folds :type etages: :param etages: number of floors :type name: :param name: name of the tower :return: Kresling tower

classmethod from_n_r_h(n, r, h1, h2, nb_stables=2, etages=1, name='')

Create a Kresling tower from n, r, h1, h2 :type n: :param n: number of folds :type r: :param r: radius of the folds :type h1: :param h1: height of the first floor :type h2: :param h2: height of the second floor :type nb_stables: :param nb_stables: number of stable positions :type etages: :param etages: number of floors :type name: :param name: name of the tower :return: Kresling tower
